comments:
When trying to submit a changed bug to bugzilla the editor gives a warning that the login and or password for bugzilla is incorrect and stops the submission. But when checking bugzilla through web it shows that the submit went through anyway. Since the user thinks that the submission failed he might retry it resulting in multiple submissions.

This seems to always happen with my bugzilla setup.  

Using Mylar 0.5.1v20060518-2100 on Eclipse3.2RC4 on WinXP Pro
Bugzilla is setup over http and a digestauthentication serves as a gateway to the whole site. The digestauthentication seems to be handled by the proxy in eclipse. 

The query was created new after being disconnected from its repository. 

If needed I can setup a testaccount for my bugzilla.
Could this be a duplicate of bug 142766?  You can distinguish hits from bugs because they only have the little blue icon in the corner and not task icon behind it.

Bug 142766 is now resolved, so please try with the latest dev build when you get a chance, or 0.5.2 if we release it by then.  If you see any more of these errors please post any stack trace that you see in the Error Log view.  Thanks Stefan!
I believe that this should be fixe for 0.5.2, please reopen if not.  Note that we still make it too easy for users to 'orphan' tasks and queries by changing or deleting repositories (bug 129402).
Will check and reopen it when error occurs again.

Created an attachment (id=42248)
Errordialog shown upon submit.

The "Error occurred while restoring saved offline Bugzilla reports" is fine and was mentioned in the New & Noteworthy.  However, that other "Error retrieving changed bug reports.." could be problematic.  It won't cause any bad behavior, but will mean that more reports than necessary are being synchronized.  Is it hapenning reguarly?  Rob, can you make sense of the IOException?

Also, regarding the error dialog, I'm unclear--is this still happening repeatedly?

Yes, the exception is realted to bug 132395. There is work to be done on error recovery in Bugzilla search. I'll do that work as part of this report, bug 132395 has been marked as depending on this one.

I have an update regarding Comment#7.
I just upgraded to RC5 and did a complete reinstall of all plugins. Then I went to the old workspace and it seems that the error dissapeared. I keep you updated if it reappears.

I'm still getting the IOException though. This time when trying to attach a context to the bug which fails with that exception. 
I try to generate a test that is reproducible. Might this be related to the bugzilla setup?
Yes, this does look like a repository misconfiguration (ie wrong username or password) but if not, I'll be looking into this further. Any information you can give me will help.

It can't be a passowrd user misconfiguration since I'm able to access all the related bugs from the web. But the password username error went away after upgrading to RC5 and reinstalling all plugins. 
It seems that Mylar doesn't like it when upgrading Eclipse version and using an old external plugin location. 
It might have to do with the fact that I'm protecting the bugzilla repository with a digestauthentication.
So are you able to submit properly now?

(In reply to comment #12)
> So are you able to submit properly now? 
> 
Yes I can submit bugs and read them properly. But I'm still unable to attach context to bug due to the mentioned IOException. Not sure if I should file this as a separate bug so we can close this one. What do you think?
Okay, I'll mark this report resolved. Stefan, if you could file the context upload problem as a separate report along with how to reproduce (and version info) that would be excellent.
